intro: Lessertia tumida, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is well-known for its ornamental value in horticulture. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
